intro: Carmichaelia orbiculata, commonly known as the New Zealand broom, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant typically grows in coastal and forested areas, thriving in well-drained soils. It produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
